articles.title: Silicon Valley spooks the AI safety advocates
articles.summary: The White House's David Sacks and OpenAI's Jason Kwon caused a stir online this week for their comments about groups promoting AI safety.
articles.content: The White House's David Sacks and OpenAI's Jason Kwon caused a stir online this week for their comments about groups promoting AI safety.

articles.title: Your AI tools run on fracked gas and bulldozed Texas land
articles.summary: If you're wondering why AI companies are pursuing this path, they'll tell you it's not just about electricity — it's about beating China.
articles.content: If you're wondering why AI companies are pursuing this path, they'll tell you it's not just about electricity — it's about beating China.
articles.author: Connie Loizos

articles.title: Should AI do everything? OpenAI thinks so
articles.summary: Silicon Valley’s rule.  It’s not cool to be cautious.
articles.content: Silicon Valley’s rule? It’s not cool to be cautious. As OpenAI removes guardrails and VCs criticize companies like Anthropic for supporting AI safety regulations, it’s becoming clearer who the industry thinks should shape AI development.  On this episode of Equity, Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha,
articles.author: Theresa Loconsolo

articles.title: Facebook’s AI can now suggest edits to the photos still on your phone
articles.summary: Facebook is rolling out a new Meta AI photo suggestion feature across the U.  and Canada that lets its AI recommend edits to images stored on users’ camera rolls — even if they haven’t been shared.
articles.content: Facebook is rolling out a new Meta AI photo suggestion feature across the U.S. and Canada that lets its AI recommend edits to images stored on users’ camera rolls — even if they haven’t been shared. The feature is currently opt-in only.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: ChatGPT’s mobile app is seeing slowing download growth and daily use, analysis shows
articles.summary: ChatGPT’s mobile app may have reached its growth peak, according to new data from app intelligence firm Apptopia.
articles.content: ChatGPT’s mobile app may have reached its growth peak, according to new data from app intelligence firm Apptopia.

articles.title: Last flash sale before TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 doors open — save up to $624
articles.summary: Today is your last chance to save.  Register for TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 before 11:59 p.
articles.content: Today is your last chance to save! Register for TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 before 11:59 p.m. PT tonight and save up to $624 on your pass. This is the lowest rate available before Disrupt hits San Francisco’s Moscone West on October 27-29. After today, prices rise.
articles.author: TechCrunch Events

articles.title: Google AI tool pinpoints genetic drivers of cancer
articles.summary: Google has announced DeepSomatic, an AI tool that can identify cancer-related mutations in tumour genetic sequences more accurately.  Cancer starts when the controls governing cell division malfunctio.
articles.content: Google has announced DeepSomatic, an AI tool that can identify cancer-related mutations in tumour genetic sequences more accurately. Cancer starts when the controls governing cell division malfunction. Finding the specific genetic mutations driving a tumour’s growth is essential for creating e
articles.author: Ryan Daws

articles.title: South Korea scraps AI textbook programme
articles.summary: The South Korean government spent 1. 2 trillion won ($850m) on developing AI textbooks for schools, but the national programme has been rolled back after just four months, amid allegations of inaccura.
articles.content: The South Korean government spent 1.2 trillion won ($850m) on developing AI textbooks for schools, but the national programme has been rolled back after just four months, amid allegations of inaccurate texts, concerns about privacy, and increased workloads on staff and pupils. Writing in Rest Of Wor
articles.author: Joe Green

articles.title: What if AI is the next dot-com bubble?
articles.summary: The surge of multi-billion-dollar investments in AI has sparked growing debate over whether the industry is heading for a bubble similar to the dot-com boom.  Investors are watching closely for signs .
articles.content: The surge of multi-billion-dollar investments in AI has sparked growing debate over whether the industry is heading for a bubble similar to the dot-com boom. Investors are watching closely for signs that enthusiasm might be fading or that the heavy spending on infrastructure and chips is failing to
articles.author: Muhammad Zulhusni

articles.title: SK Telecom’s AI unit offers staff voluntary retirement program just weeks after launch
articles.summary: All staff employed by SK Telecom's new AI division are being offered a voluntary retirement program as part of a broader effort to bring together its various AI-related divisions, the company confirme.
articles.content: All staff employed by SK Telecom's new AI division are being offered a voluntary retirement program as part of a broader effort to bring together its various AI-related divisions, the company confirmed to TechCrunch.
articles.author: Kate Park

articles.title: Meta previews new parental controls for its AI experiences
articles.summary: Starting in the coming months, parents will be able to turn off chats with AI characters entirely for teens.  This action won't block access to the Meta AI chatbot -- the company's general-purpose AI .
articles.content: Starting in the coming months, parents will be able to turn off chats with AI characters entirely for teens. This action won't block access to the Meta AI chatbot -- the company's general-purpose AI chatbot -- which will only discuss age-appropriate content.
articles.author: Ivan Mehta

articles.title: From slop to Sotheby’s? AI art enters a new phase
articles.summary: In this era of AI slop, the idea that generative AI tools like Midjourney and Runway could be used to make art can seem absurd: What possible artistic value is there to be found in the likes of Shrimp.
articles.content: In this era of AI slop, the idea that generative AI tools like Midjourney and Runway could be used to make art can seem absurd: What possible artistic value is there to be found in the likes of Shrimp Jesus and Ballerina Cappuccina? But amid all the muck, there are people using AI tools with…
articles.author: Grace Huckins

articles.title: Reddit expands its AI-powered search to 5 new languages
articles.summary: Users who have set one of these languages as their default, instead of English, can now chat with the AI in question-and-answer format.
articles.content: Users who have set one of these languages as their default, instead of English, can now chat with the AI in question-and-answer format.
articles.author: Ivan Mehta

articles.title: OpenAI pauses Sora video generations of Martin Luther King Jr.
articles.summary: Sora's launch has stirred fervent public debate around the dangers of AI-generated videos and how platforms should implement guardrails around the technology.
articles.content: Sora's launch has stirred fervent public debate around the dangers of AI-generated videos and how platforms should implement guardrails around the technology.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff

articles.title: Kayak launches an ‘AI Mode’ for travel questions, search, and bookings
articles.summary: Kayak is bringing AI directly to its main platform with a new “AI Mode” that lets travelers research, plan, and book trips through a built-in chatbot.
articles.content: Kayak is bringing AI directly to its main platform with a new “AI Mode” that lets travelers research, plan, and book trips through a built-in chatbot.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Why AI startups are taking data into their own hands
articles.summary: Where training sets were once scraped freely from the web or collected from low-paid annotators, companies are looking to proprietary training data as a competitive advantage.
articles.content: Where training sets were once scraped freely from the web or collected from low-paid annotators, companies are looking to proprietary training data as a competitive advantage.
articles.author: Russell Brandom

articles.title: Apple loses another AI exec to Meta
articles.summary: Yang’s departure marks the latest in a string of exits from Apple’s AI unit, putting the company into jeopardy in the lead-up to a much-anticipated Siri revamp scheduled for March.
articles.content: Yang’s departure marks the latest in a string of exits from Apple’s AI unit, putting the company into jeopardy in the lead-up to a much-anticipated Siri revamp scheduled for March.
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan

articles.title: Pinterest adds controls to let you  limit the amount of ‘AI slop’ in your feed
articles.summary: Pinterest is rolling out new controls that let users limit how much AI-generated content appears in their feeds.  The company is also making its AI content labels more visible.
articles.content: Pinterest is rolling out new controls that let users limit how much AI-generated content appears in their feeds. The company is also making its AI content labels more visible.
articles.author: Sarah Perez
